snippet: Jan Troell’s latest film, “The Last Sentence,” is a portrait of Torgny Segerstedt, a Swedish newspaper editor who was an early, ferocious and persistent critic of Hitler.
abstract: Profile of director Jan Troell, whose latest film The Last Sentence explores life of Torgny Segerstedt, Swedish newspaper editor who became fierce critic of Hitler during World War 2.
lead_paragraph: Jan Troell’s latest film, “The Last Sentence,” is a portrait of Torgny Segerstedt, a Swedish newspaper editor who was an early, ferocious and persistent critic of Hitler.

headline.seo: Jan Troell’s Film ‘The Last Sentence’ Looks at a Swedish Editor Who Defied Nazi Threats
headline.main: Swedish Auteur Takes On a Brave Loner
headline.print_headline: Swedish Auteur Takes on a Brave Loner
